actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to provide reductions in individual tax rates which are conditioned on reductions in the levels of Federal expenditures.

summary.text: Tax Reduction Act of 1979 - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to lower individual income tax rates. Provides that the scheduled reductions in such rates shall not take effect if, after adoption of the second concurrent resolution on the Congressional budget, Federal expenditures exceed specified percentages of the gross national product during such years or if Congress declares that such reductions are not warranted due to the state of the economy or a national emergency.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to provide reductions in individual tax rates which are conditioned on reductions in the levels of Federal expenditures.
